refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: The b10-stats daemon collects statistics data from each BIND 10 module. Its statistics information may be reported via bindctl or b10-stats-httpd. It is started by bind10 and communicates by using the Command Channel by b10-msgq with other modules like bind10, b10-auth and so on. b10-stats periodically requests statistics data to each module and receives. The interval time can be configured via bindctl. b10-stats cannot accept any command from other modules for updating statistics data. The stats module collects data and aggregates it. b10-stats invokes an internal command for bind10 after its initial starting to make sure it collects statistics data from bind10.

refsect1.title: CONFIGURATION AND COMMANDS
refsect1.para: The only configurable setting in stats.spec is:

listitem.para: is a time interval in seconds at which b10-stats requests each module to return its statistics data. The default is 60 seconds. Polling can be disabled by setting it to 0. The type of the value should be an unsigned integer. Negative integers are ignored.

refsect1.para: show will send the statistics data in JSON format. By default, it outputs all the statistics data it has collected. An optional item name may be specified to receive individual output.
showschema will send the schema of the statistics data in JSON format. The output is equivalent to the statistics part of stats.spec.
shutdown will shutdown the b10-stats process. This has an optional pid argument to select the process ID to stop. (Note that the BIND 10 boss process may restart this service if configured.)
status simply indicates that the daemon is running.

refsect1.title: STATISTICS DATA
refsect1.para: The b10-stats daemon contains these Stats statistics:

listitem.simpara: The date and time when this daemon was started in ISO 8601 format. This is a constant which can't be reset except by restarting b10-stats.
The date and time (in ISO 8601 format) when this daemon last received data from another component.
This is the name used for the b10-msgq command-control channel. (This is a constant which can't be reset except by restarting b10-stats.)
The latest report date and time in ISO 8601 format.
This is the date and time (in ISO 8601 format) when this daemon started collecting data.
The current date and time represented in seconds since UNIX epoch (1970-01-01T00:00:00Z) with precision (delimited with a period) up to one hundred thousandth of second.

refsect1.para: See other manual pages for explanations for their statistics that are kept track by b10-stats.

refsect1.title: FILES
refsect1.para:

— This is a spec file for b10-stats. It contains commands for b10-stats. They can be invoked via bindctl1.
